English: You may meet him.
French: Tu peux le rencontrer.

English: I hope you have a good trip.
French: Je vous souhaite un bon voyage.

English: Why didn't you tell us there was a witness?
French: Que ne nous avez-vous pas dit qu'il y avait un témoin ?

English: You chose a good one.
French: Tu en as choisi une bonne.

English: She proposed giving a party.
French: Elle suggéra de faire une fête.

English: There was steady economic improvement.
French: Il y avait une solide amélioration économique.

English: Every time I went to his house, he was not at home.
French: À chaque fois que j'allais chez lui, il n'était pas là.

English: He chose to live in Tokyo instead of Osaka.
French: Il a choisi de vivre à Tokyo au lieu d'Osaka.

English: I talked.
French: J’ai parlé.

English: Do you really think Tom is better than I am?
French: Penses-tu vraiment que Tom est meilleur que moi ?

English: Maybe I'll call you.
French: Peut-être vous appellerai-je.

English: It was not always this way.
French: Il n'en fut pas toujours ainsi.

English: What is he like?
French: Comment est-il ?

English: Are you here to arrest me?
French: Êtes-vous ici pour m'arrêter ?

English: I'm not crying.
French: Je ne pleure pas.

English: Don't forget that.
French: N'oubliez pas ça.

English: You seem really busy this morning.
French: Vous avez l'air très occupée ce matin.

English: I just want to say I love you.
French: Je veux simplement dire que je t'aime.

English: Let me paint you a picture.
French: Laisse-moi te dresser un tableau !

English: She owns many valuable works.
French: Elle possède de nombreux ouvrages de valeur.

English: You've got to do this for me.
French: Vous devez faire ceci pour moi.

English: Don't stay here.
French: Ne restez pas ici !

English: All the boys ran away.
French: Tous les garçons s'enfuirent.

English: Is anyone surprised?
French: Quiconque est-il surpris ?

English: The girl entered the room.
French: La fille est entrée dans la pièce.

English: After a while, he came to.
French: Après un moment, il revint à lui.

English: You should be happy for me.
French: Vous devriez être heureux pour moi.

English: I'm afraid of earthquakes.
French: J'ai peur des tremblements de terre.

English: We arrived here in the evening.
French: Nous sommes arrivés ici le soir.

English: I have an important mission for all of you.
French: J'ai une importante mission pour vous tous.

English: It doesn't matter what game he plays, he always wins.
French: Le jeu auquel il joue n'a pas d'importance, il gagne toujours.

English: Tom is in the living room.
French: Tom est dans le salon.

English: A car has one steering wheel.
French: Une voiture a un volant.

English: Everyone working for us earns more than the minimum wage.
French: Tout ceux travaillant pour nous gagnent plus que le salaire minimum.

English: I know you're scared.
French: Je sais que vous avez peur.

English: You're pretty good.
French: Vous êtes plutôt bon.

English: Tell us about your family.
French: Parle-nous de ta famille !

English: The rocket blew up a few seconds after launch.
French: La fusée explosa quelques secondes après son lancement.

English: I will stay home if it rains tomorrow.
French: Je resterai chez moi s'il pleut demain.

English: My dog has fleas.
French: Mon chien a des puces.

English: Tom is a bit under the weather.
French: Tom a un coup dans l’aile.

English: I usually get up at six.
French: Je me lève d'habitude à six heures.

English: I was in bed by nine.
French: J'étais au lit à neuf heures.

English: Please add up the bill.
French: Mettez ça sur la note.

English: This condo is getting old. Why don't we redecorate to give it a fresh feel?
French: L'appartement se fait vieux. Pourquoi ne le redécorerions-nous pas pour en rafraîchir l'allure.

English: I'd very much like to go.
French: J'aimerais beaucoup y aller.

English: I really like your music.
French: J'aime vraiment ta musique.

English: Everybody, get out of my house.
French: Tout le monde, sortez de ma maison.

English: She advised him to take better care of himself.
French: Elle lui a conseillé de prendre davantage soin de lui-même.

English: He asked her where her mother was.
French: Il lui a demandé où était sa mère.

English: You'll have to work a lot.
French: Vous devrez beaucoup travailler.

English: None of us can see them.
French: Aucun de nous ne peut les voir.

English: Please answer my question.
French: Merci de répondre à ma question.

English: You shouldn't have followed me.
French: Vous n'auriez pas dû me suivre.

English: Could you put these in a box?
French: Pourrais-tu mettre ceux-ci dans une boîte ?

English: Many people spend more than they earn.
French: Beaucoup de gens dépensent davantage qu'ils ne gagnent.

English: Tom warned Mary to stay away from his house.
French: Tom a prévenu Mary de rester loin de sa maison.

English: I don't have any Canadian friends.
French: Je n'ai aucun ami Canadien.

English: I don't think you'd understand it.
French: Je ne pense pas que tu comprendrais.

English: Who knew about this?
French: Qui était au courant ?

English: There's not much difference.
French: Il n'y a guère de différence.

English: Tom's at the door. Please ask him to come in.
French: Tom est à la porte. S'il te plaît, dis-lui d'entrer.

English: What would you like?
French: Qu'aimerais-tu ?

English: Are you coming or not?
French: Viens-tu ou non ?

English: Do you know where to go or who to ask for information?
French: Savez-vous où vous rendre ou à qui demander pour obtenir des informations ?

English: They could've killed you.
French: Ils auraient pu vous tuer.

English: You can sing a song.
French: Tu peux chanter une chanson.

English: We'll get in touch with you as soon as possible.
French: Nous vous contacterons au plus vite.

English: The living room furniture was modern in style.
French: Le mobilier du salon était de style moderne.

English: Your English has improved a lot.
French: Ton anglais s'est beaucoup amélioré.

English: Where would you like to go next?
French: Où souhaiterais-tu aller ensuite ?

English: I take a bath every other day.
French: Je prends un bain tous les deux jours.

English: I heard yelling.
French: J'ai entendu hurler.

English: I'm not paid to do that.
French: Je ne suis pas payée pour faire cela.

English: I know it sounds strange, but it's true.
French: Je sais que ça paraît étrange, mais c'est vrai.

English: I'm glad you met Tom.
French: Je suis heureuse que tu aies rencontré Tom.

English: Don't drink that.
French: Ne buvez pas ça !

English: Tom doesn't want to leave.
French: Tom ne veut pas partir.

English: People believe what they want to believe.
French: Les gens croient ce qu'ils veulent croire.

English: Can they see us?
French: Peuvent-ils nous voir ?

English: The bill, please.
French: La note, s'il vous plait.

English: Money has changed his life.
French: L'argent a changé sa vie.

English: Tom must be wrong.
French: Tom doit avoir tort.

English: Tom took a taxi to the hospital.
French: Tom alla à l'hôpital en taxi.

English: I fully understand your concerns.
French: Je comprends parfaitement vos inquiétudes.

English: Why don't you just study a little harder?
French: Pourquoi n'étudies-tu pas un peu plus assidument ?

English: The sun is rising now.
French: Le soleil se lève à présent.

English: How did you get into Harvard?
French: Comment es-tu entré à Harvard ?

English: I never thought I'd ever see you again.
French: Je n'ai jamais pensé que je vous reverrais un jour.

English: I don't understand what that means.
French: Je ne comprend pas ce que cela signifie.

English: I'm sure you're going to like this.
French: Je suis sûre que tu vas aimer ça.

English: How do you usually decide what to eat?
French: Comment décides-tu habituellement quoi manger ?

English: He came to Japan seven years ago.
French: Il est venu au Japon il y a sept ans.

English: Are you retarded or something?
French: Es-tu attardé mental ou quoi ?

English: I told you everything I knew.
French: Je t'ai dit tout ce que je savais.

English: Would you be interested in coming with us?
French: Seriez-vous intéressé de venir avec nous ?

English: That's why I called you.
French: C'est pourquoi je vous ai appelé.

English: We understand that completely.
French: Nous comprenons cela complètement.

English: How about playing golf this afternoon?
French: Que diriez-vous de jouer au golf cet après-midi ?

English: What are you doing?
French: Qu'es-tu en train de faire ?

English: The other team has some really good players.
French: L'autre équipe a quelques très bons joueurs.

English: Just tell Tom to leave me alone.
French: Dis juste à Tom de me laisser seule.

English: If you don't want to go, you don't have to.
French: Si tu ne veux pas y aller, tu n'y es pas obligée.

English: When I got my driver's license renewed, I had to decide if I wanted to be an organ donor.
French: Quand j'ai fait renouvelé mon permis de conduire, j'ai dû décider si je voulais être donneur d'organe.

English: He spent another sleepless night watching television.
French: Il a encore passé une nuit blanche devant la télévision.

English: Can I take a selfie with you?
French: Puis-je prendre un selfie avec vous ?

English: He wanted to know more about the trees, too.
French: Il voulait aussi en savoir davantage sur les arbres.

English: Do you have an alibi?
French: Disposes-tu d'un alibi ?

English: I want to talk to you about this report.
French: Je veux te parler au sujet de ce rapport.

English: I figured you wouldn't want to go there without me.
French: Je me figurais que vous ne voudriez pas y aller sans moi.

English: I don't have long.
French: Je ne dispose pas de beaucoup de temps.

English: Is that our problem?
French: Est-ce notre problème ?

English: I like long stories with surprise endings.
French: J'aime les longues histoires avec des fins surprenantes.

English: He asked me to.
French: Il me l'a demandé.

English: They were surprised by what they saw.
French: Elles furent surprises de ce qu'elles virent.

English: I might be wrong.
French: Il se peut que j'aie tort.

English: They loaded the truck.
French: Ils ont chargé le camion.

English: Don't tell your mother what you've seen here.
French: Ne dites pas à votre mère ce que vous avez vu ici.

English: Don't try to talk right now.
French: N'essaye pas tout de suite de parler !

English: I figured you weren't coming.
French: Je me suis figurée que vous ne veniez pas.

English: Is there a parking lot?
French: Y a-t-il un parking ?

English: This pizza is really good.
French: Cette pizza est vraiment bonne.

English: It was too soft.
French: C'était trop doux.

English: I've always considered you a close friend.
French: Je t'ai toujours considéré comme un ami proche.

English: Tom was lying on the couch.
French: Tom était allongé sur le canapé.

English: Did Tom eat?
French: Est-ce que Tom a mangé ?

English: I didn't want to give up.
French: Je ne voulais pas abandonner.

English: I don't want Tom to go to jail.
French: Je ne veux pas que Tom aille en prison.

English: I didn't wait for Tom.
French: Je n'ai pas attendu Tom.

English: It's not spring yet.
French: Ce n'est pas encore le printemps.

English: Will you dance with me?
French: Danserez-vous avec moi ?

English: I really don't want to eat right now.
French: Je ne veux vraiment pas manger maintenant.

English: When I was thirteen years old, I couldn't speak French at all.
French: Quand j'avais treize ans, je ne pouvais pas du tout parler français.

English: I think his name is Tom.
French: Je crois qu'il s'appelle Tom.

English: Spring fever is not a disease.
French: La montée de sève n'est pas une maladie.

English: Are we being charged with something?
French: Faisons-nous l'objet d'une accusation ?

English: You're lazy.
French: Vous êtes paresseux.

English: My parents caught me smoking.
French: Mes parents m'ont attrapée en train de fumer.

English: We made it.
French: Nous l'avons accompli.

English: Give us a few hours.
French: Donne-nous quelques heures.

English: It's a question of taste.
French: Affaire de goût.

English: She held her breath.
French: Elle retint son souffle.

English: He was a brave soldier.
French: C'était un brave soldat.

English: Do you deny it?
French: Le nies-tu ?

English: Aren't you hungry?
French: Tu n'as pas faim ?

English: Where is the police station?
French: Où le poste de police se trouve-t-il ?

English: She grew up to be a lovely woman like her mother.
French: Elle a grandi pour devenir une jolie femme comme sa mère.

English: Her face turned white.
French: Son visage vira au blanc.

English: You've made that clear.
French: Vous avez été clair.

English: I feared the worst.
French: Je craignis le pire.

English: Who was your French teacher?
French: Qui était votre professeur de français?

English: He knows every inch of this area.
French: Il connaît tout dans ce domaine.

English: This isn't your office.
French: Ce n'est pas ton bureau.

English: She watched him draw a picture.
French: Elle l'a regardé tracer un dessin.

English: Maybe he'll come tomorrow.
French: Peut-être viendra-t-il demain.

English: Wild animals live in the forest.
French: Des animaux sauvages vivent dans la forêt.

English: He is in excellent physical condition.
French: Il est en excellente condition physique.

English: We're counting on you to wake us up in time, so don't fall asleep.
French: On compte sur toi pour nous réveiller à l'heure, alors ne t'endors pas.

English: I remember what you said the other day.
French: Je me rappelle ce que tu as dit l'autre jour.

English: He thought up an excuse.
French: Il s'inventa une excuse.

English: Why are these photos so important?
French: Pourquoi ces photos sont-elles si importantes ?

English: Today is my treat.
French: Aujourd'hui, c'est moi qui régale.

English: Tom is starved.
French: Tom est affamé.

English: We'll all be here for you.
French: Nous serons toutes là pour toi.

English: Tom loves you. I know he does.
French: Tom t'aime. Je le sais.

English: What do you think happens then?
French: Que penses-tu, alors, qu'il arrive ?

English: I'm a geologist.
French: Je suis géologue.

English: The explosion frightened the villagers.
French: L'explosion a terrorisé les villageois.

English: Did you go straight home after school yesterday?
French: Êtes-vous directement rentrée chez vous hier, après l'école ?

English: Our children all go to the local school.
French: Nos enfants vont tous à l'école locale.

English: I just wanted to tell you how pleased I am.
French: Je voulais juste te dire combien j'étais satisfaite.

English: We're doomed.
French: Nous sommes condamnés.

English: Columbus' discovery of America was accidental.
French: La découverte de l'Amérique par Colomb fut accidentelle.

English: Don't be upset.
French: Ne soyez pas fâchées !

English: He wants to marry my daughter.
French: Il veut épouser ma fille.

English: I knew it was a lie.
French: Je savais qu'il s'agissait d'un mensonge.

English: I have an appointment with the doctor.
French: J'ai rendez-vous chez le docteur.

English: Let's figure out a better way to do this.
French: Trouvons un meilleur moyen de faire ceci.

English: The tubes are clogged.
French: Les tubes sont bouchés.

English: Tom is probably in the building.
French: Tom est probablement dans le bâtiment.

English: He never takes into account the fact that I am very busy.
French: Il ne tient jamais compte du fait que je sois très occupé.

English: I haven't got all day, you know.
French: Je n'ai pas toute la journée, tu sais.

English: You're lucky nobody saw you do that.
French: Tu es chanceuse que personne ne t'ait vue faire ça.

English: I thought I'd surprise you.
French: Je pensais te surprendre.

English: I can't believe I'm stuck here in this room with you.
French: Je n'arrive pas à croire que je sois coincée ici, dans cette pièce, avec toi.

English: Where are they taking you?
French: Où t'emmènent-elles ?

English: You're a bodybuilder, aren't you?
French: Tu es culturiste, n'est-ce pas ?

English: I'm really proud of you.
French: Je suis réellement fière de vous.

English: I'm happy enough.
French: Je suis assez contente.

English: I couldn't do that.
French: Je n'ai pas pu faire ça.

English: I didn't even know that you had one.
French: Je ne savais même pas que tu en avais un.

English: I like traveling.
French: J'aime voyager.

English: Do you know what time they came?
French: Savez-vous à quelle heure ils sont venus ?

English: She sometimes takes a walk in the park.
French: Elle se promène parfois dans le parc.

English: She did it again.
French: Elle l'a fait à nouveau.

English: He nudged me to go ahead.
French: Il me poussa du coude à poursuivre.

English: It is difficult to translate a poem into another language.
French: Il est difficile de traduire un poème dans une autre langue.

English: Get in the back seat.
French: Monte dans le siège arrière.

English: I wonder what Tom actually thinks.
French: Je me demande ce que Tom pense vraiment.

English: We must follow the rules.
French: Nous devons suivre les règles.

English: Tom played tennis with Mary yesterday.
French: Hier, Tom a joué au tennis avec Marie.

English: It's supposed to get colder and snow later today.
French: Ça devrait se refroidir et neiger plus tard dans la journée.

English: I'm no different than you.
French: Je ne suis pas différent de vous.

English: I actually don't work here.
French: Je ne travaille en fait pas ici.

English: When he saw her letter, he felt somewhat uneasy.
French: Lorsqu'il vit sa lettre, il se sentit un peu mal à l'aise.

English: Tom will do that for free.
French: Tom le fera gratuitement.

English: Sit back, relax and enjoy the ride.
French: Appuie-toi sur ton dossier, détends-toi et prends plaisir à la ballade !

English: They never returned to their country.
French: Jamais elles ne retournèrent dans leur pays.

English: We can't live without water for even one day.
French: Nous ne pouvons vivre sans eau, même pour un jour.

English: You're a winner.
French: T'es un gagneur.

English: You talk too fast.
French: Tu parles trop vite.

English: We've gone too far.
French: Nous sommes allés trop loin.

English: I don't care what you do with it.
French: Je me fiche de ce que vous en faites.

English: I wish I'd made better use of my time.
French: J'aurais aimé faire meilleur usage de mon temps.

English: Take one of these.
French: Prends l'une de celles-ci !

English: You're new here, aren't you?
French: Tu es nouvelle ici, n'est-ce pas ?

English: The birds were flying in a group.
French: Les oiseaux volaient en formation.

English: Have you bought a watermelon?
French: As-tu acheté une pastèque ?

English: I wasn't good enough.
French: Je n'étais pas assez bonne.

English: It's not like you're going to get arrested or anything.
French: Tu ne vas pas te faire arrêter ou quelque chose comme ça !

English: Dozens of young people attended the demonstration.
French: Des dizaines de jeunes ont assisté à la manifestation.

English: I can't believe you're eating what the doctor told you not to eat.
French: Je n'arrive pas à croire que tu manges ce que le médecin t'a prescrit de ne pas manger.

English: I know how hard that is.
French: Je sais à quel point c'est difficile.

English: He isn't as stupid as he looks.
French: Il n'est pas aussi bête qu'il en a l'air.

English: He postponed leaving for Hokkaido until next month.
French: Il a repoussé son départ pour Hokkaido au mois prochain.

English: I can't kiss you now.
French: Je ne peux t'embrasser maintenant.

English: Why not just tell Tom?
French: Pourquoi ne pas simplement le dire à Tom ?

English: Is it good news?
French: Est-ce une bonne nouvelle ?

English: I want to do it myself.
French: Je veux le faire par moi-même.

English: Tom said he tried to kiss Mary.
French: Tom a dit qu'il avait essayé d'embrasser Mary.

English: You're losing.
French: Vous êtes en train de perdre.

English: I sincerely hope that you will soon recover from your illness.
French: J'espère sincèrement que tu te remettras bientôt de ta maladie.

English: There is no telling what will happen.
French: On ne peut pas dire ce qui se passera.

English: I was younger then.
French: J'étais plus jeune, à l'époque.

English: The trouble is that my son does not want to go to school.
French: L'ennui est que mon fils ne veut pas aller à l'école.

English: I'm one of Tom's teammates.
French: Je suis l'une des coéquipières de Tom.

English: I feel bad.
French: Je me sens mal.

English: She took him to the lake.
French: Elle l'a amené au lac.

English: The children are noisy.
French: Les enfants sont bruyants.

English: I suggest you go by train.
French: Je suggère que vous y alliez en train.

English: She likes Russian pop.
French: Elle aime le pop russe.

English: You're not the only neurosurgeon here.
French: Vous n'êtes pas le seul neurochirurgien ici.

English: This is my project.
French: C'est mon projet.

English: He took out his passport.
French: Il sortit son passeport.

English: I listened, but I heard nothing.
French: J'écoutai, mais je n'entendis rien.

English: Let me say a few words by way of apology.
French: Laissez-moi dire quelques mots en guise d'excuse.

English: They have the same habits.
French: Ils ont les mêmes habitudes.

English: Are you on drugs or something?
French: Tu te drogues, ou quoi ?

English: I don't want to be your boyfriend.
French: Je ne veux pas être ton copain.

English: I don't think I have the experience necessary for that job.
French: Je ne pense pas avoir l'expérience nécessaire pour cet emploi.

English: A common way to finance a budget deficit is to issue bonds.
French: Une manière répandue de financer un déficit est de proposer des obligations.

English: What more could you want?
French: Que pourriez-vous vouloir de plus ?

English: I don't care for coffee.
French: Je ne cours pas après le café.

English: I don't even vote.
French: Je ne vote même pas.

English: How long were you at the party?
French: Combien de temps as-tu été à la soirée ?

English: We're back.
French: Nous sommes de retour.

English: I'll be as quick as I can.
French: Je vais être aussi rapide que je le peux.

English: I'm very interested in the job.
French: Je suis très intéressé par le poste.

English: Have you put on sunscreen?
French: Avez-vous mis de la crème solaire ?

English: Do I have to go now?
French: Dois-je y aller maintenant ?

English: What's the commotion?
French: Quel est ce tumulte ?

English: I'm in love with you, Tom.
French: Je t'aime, Tom.

English: A magnet can pick up and hold many nails at a time.
French: Un aimant peut soulever et maintenir de nombreux clous en même temps.

English: Have you ever thought about quitting your job?
French: Avez-vous jamais songé à quitter votre emploi ?

English: I don't eat the apple core.
French: Je ne mange pas le trognon de pomme.

English: Hiking is a good exercise.
French: La randonnée pédestre est un bon exercice.

English: Is Tom a Christian?
French: Tom est-il chrétien ?

English: I can't believe that you aren't at least willing to consider the possibility of other alternatives.
French: Je n'arrive pas à croire que vous ne soyez pas au moins disposée à envisager d'autres possibilités.

English: They offered no explanation.
French: Ils n'ont fourni aucune explication.

English: We're pooped.
French: Nous sommes crevés.

English: They had an argument.
French: Ils ont eu une dispute.

English: A lot of people were killed in World War II.
French: Beaucoup de gens furent tués pendant la Seconde Guerre mondiale.

English: Stay in bed.
French: Restez alitée !

English: You worry about your weight too much.
French: Vous vous en faites trop pour votre poids.

English: I could eat a horse.
French: Je pourrais manger un cheval.

English: When's this supposed to happen?
French: Quand est-ce supposé survenir ?

English: The most important thing in the Olympic Games is not winning but taking part.
French: La chose la plus importante aux Jeux Olympiques n'est pas de gagner mais d'y prendre part.

English: I don't want to get you in trouble.
French: Je ne veux pas vous attirer d'ennuis.

English: Mary had a ring on every finger of her left hand.
French: Mary avait une bague à chaque doigt de sa main gauche.

English: Few students are interested in reading this novel.
French: Peu d'étudiants sont intéressés par la lecture de ce roman.

English: A fox is a wild animal.
French: Le renard est un animal sauvage.

English: You know who I mean.
French: Vous savez de qui je veux parler.

English: He was always pulling my leg when we worked together.
French: Lorsque nous travaillions ensemble, il ne cessait de me charrier.

English: My mother died when I was a kid.
French: Ma mère est morte lorsque j'étais enfant.

English: Please excuse my ignorance.
French: Excusez mon ignorance.

English: The news that he was still alive reached us.
French: La nouvelle disant qu'il était encore en vie nous est parvenue.

English: When I grow up, I want to be just like you.
French: Quand je serai grand, je veux être exactement comme vous.

English: You'll get into trouble if your parents find out.
French: Tu vas avoir des ennuis si tes parents découvrent ça.

English: We don't want them to be uncomfortable.
French: Nous ne voulons pas qu'ils soient mal à l'aise.

English: Do you need the key?
French: Est-ce que tu as besoin de la clé ?

English: The tree in front of the library was struck by lightning.
French: L'arbre devant la bibliothèque a était frappé par la foudre.

English: Have a nice weekend!
French: Bon week-end.

English: If the medicine isn't working, maybe we should up the dosage.
French: Si le médicament ne fait pas effet, peut-être devrions-nous augmenter la dose.

English: Her classmates do not appreciate her.
French: Ses camarades de classe ne l'apprécient pas.

English: I live in a small fishing village.
French: J'habite dans un petit village de pêcheurs.

English: Tom was obviously disgusted.
French: Tom était assurément dégoûté.

English: You don't know German, do you?
French: Tu ne sais pas l'allemand, si ?

English: Do you want to touch it?
French: Voulez-vous le toucher ?

English: I'm sorry to bother you, but we've got a small problem.
French: Je suis désolée de vous ennuyer mais nous avons un petit problème.

English: This is an unusual situation.
French: C'est une situation inhabituelle.

English: We're finally alone.
French: On est enfin seuls.

English: Have a taste.
French: Goûtez !

English: I did it like this.
French: Je l'ai fait ainsi.

English: What newspaper do you subscribe to?
French: À quel journal êtes-vous abonné ?

English: He wants to squish the bug.
French: Il veut écraser la bestiole.

English: I can see the light.
French: J'arrive à voir la lumière.

English: He won the election by a large majority.
French: Il a remporté l'élection par une large majorité.

English: I feel secure with him.
French: Je me sens en sécurité avec lui.

English: Is it happening?
French: Se produit-il ?

English: You can't believe a word he says.
French: On ne peut pas croire un mot de ce qu'il dit.

English: Do you need a lift?
French: Vous avez besoin d'un chauffeur ?

English: Did you forget to do your homework?
French: As-tu oublié de faire tes devoirs ?

English: According to the radio, it will snow tomorrow.
French: D'après la radio, il va neiger demain.

English: You should be real proud of yourself.
French: Vous devriez être très fier de vous.

English: I'm gaining weight.
French: Je prends du poids.

English: How do you know what I said?
French: Comment sais-tu ce que j'ai dit ?

English: I want you to take me with you.
French: Je veux que tu m'emmènes avec toi.

English: He lives on this street.
French: Il vit dans cette rue.

English: Which kind of watch do you prefer, digital or analog?
French: Quelle sorte de montre préfères-tu ? Numérique ou analogique ?

English: If Tom comes, please give him this book.
French: Si Tom vient, donne-lui s'il te plaît ce livre.

English: Don't forget to send the letter.
French: N'oublie pas de poster la lettre.

English: That might not be a good idea.
French: Cela ne serait peut-être pas une bonne idée.

English: He is wearing glasses.
French: Il porte des lunettes.

English: I miss you badly.
French: Tu me manques énormément.

English: I don't think I can keep that promise.
French: Je ne pense pas pouvoir tenir cette promesse.

English: Is there a man in your life?
French: Y a-t-il un homme dans ta vie ?

English: To tell the truth, I didn't notice it.
French: À dire vrai, je ne l'ai pas remarqué.

English: Is that why you're upset?
French: Est-ce pour cela que vous êtes fâchée ?

English: I'm not good at this.
French: Je ne suis pas bon à ça.

English: I said I didn't remember.
French: J'ai dit que je ne m'en souvenais pas.

English: I don't remember where you live.
French: Je ne me rappelle pas où tu habites.

English: The kitchen is downstairs.
French: La cuisine est à l'étage en-dessous.

English: How much thinner do you want to be?
French: De combien veux-tu être plus mince ?

English: Tom often quarrels with his wife.
French: Tom se dispute souvent avec sa femme.

English: As I told you before, I have no choice.
French: Comme je te l'ai dit auparavant, je n'ai pas le choix.

English: Give me something I can cut this with.
French: Donnez-moi quelque chose avec lequel je peux couper ceci.

English: John is two years older than I am.
French: John a deux ans de plus que moi.

English: I've read that book.
French: J'ai lu ce livre.

English: I was very busy this week.
French: J'ai été très occupé cette semaine.

English: I'm sorry I missed your birthday.
French: Je suis désolée d'avoir raté ton anniversaire.

English: Here is your book.
French: Voici ton livre.

English: I don't want to talk about it now.
French: Je ne souhaite pas en parler maintenant.

English: Do I have to wait long?
French: Dois-je attendre longtemps ?

English: I want to eat something that isn't sweet.
French: Je veux manger quelque chose de pas sucré.

English: She is always smoking.
French: Elle est toujours à fumer.

English: This blue sweater is very pretty.
French: Ce pull bleu est très beau.

English: Are you interested?
French: Êtes-vous intéressés ?

English: We communicate with each other by telephone every day.
French: Nous communiquons quotidiennement par téléphone.

English: Most elevators operate automatically.
French: La plupart des ascenseurs fonctionnent automatiquement.

English: I apologize for coming by at such a late hour.
French: Je vous présente mes excuses pour passer à une heure si tardive.

English: He impressed me with his magic tricks.
French: Il m'a impressionné avec ses tours de magie.

English: It was not until yesterday that I knew her name.
French: Ce n'est que depuis hier que j'ai appris son nom.

English: The pay is meager.
French: La paie est maigre.

English: It's gotten better.
French: Elle s'est améliorée.

English: A third of the earth's surface is desert.
French: Un tiers de la surface de la Terre est du désert.

English: He got angry.
French: Il s'est fâché.

English: Is anybody here?
French: Il y a quelqu'un ?

English: He had been working in the factory for three years when the accident occurred.
French: Cela faisait trois ans qu'il travaillait dans l'usine lorsque l'accident s'est produit.

English: He writes to his mother every now and then.
French: Il écrit une lettre à sa mère de temps en temps.

English: What do you mean?
French: Que veux-tu dire ?

English: I feel so cold.
French: J'ai tellement froid.

English: I've given this quite a lot of thought.
French: J'ai beaucoup réfléchi à ça.

English: This bird can't fly.
French: Cet oiseau ne peut pas voler.

English: He did not enjoy his lessons.
French: Il n'appréciait pas ses leçons.

English: School reopens in September.
French: L'école rouvre en septembre.

English: I was out of town on vacation.
French: J'étais en vacances hors de la ville.

English: We were both wrong.
French: On se trompait tous les deux.

English: We have another ten miles to walk before sunset.
French: Nous devons encore marcher dix miles avant le coucher du soleil.

English: My boyfriend is not a loser.
French: Mon petit ami n'est pas un loser.

English: Red is better.
French: Rouge, c'est mieux.

English: Was it you that left the door open last night?
French: Était-ce toi qui as laissé la porte ouverte la nuit passée ?

English: I have no recollection of seeing the man.
French: Je n'ai aucun souvenir d'avoir vu l'homme.

English: It doesn't rain here very often.
French: Il ne pleut pas très souvent ici.

English: Why don't you start by telling us what you saw?
French: Pourquoi ne commencez-vous pas par nous dire ce que vous avez vu ?

English: I always rely on him in times of trouble.
French: Je me repose toujours sur lui en cas de problème.

English: There are not many books on these shelves.
French: Il n'y a pas beaucoup de livres sur ces étagères.

English: I entrusted my wife with the family finances.
French: J'ai confié à ma femme les finances du foyer.

English: We can't win.
French: Nous ne pouvons par l'emporter.

English: That would be nice if it were true.
French: Ça serait bien si c'était vrai.

English: Is Sunday the first day of the week?
French: Dimanche est-il le premier jour de la semaine ?

English: Tom told me he was going to commit suicide.
French: Tom m'a dit qu'il allait se suicider.

English: Why don't you ride your bicycle to work?
French: Pourquoi ne vas-tu pas au travail à vélo?

English: Don't touch that dial.
French: Ne touche pas à ce cadran !

English: You're not looking at the whole picture.
French: Vous ne regardez pas l'ensemble du tableau.

English: Walk slowly.
French: Marche lentement.

English: I think Tom would probably disagree with you.
French: Je pense que Tom ne serait probablement pas d'accord avec vous.

English: I did something I regretted doing.
French: J'ai fait quelque chose que j'ai regretté avoir fait.

English: You overestimate him.
French: Vous le surestimez.

English: His house was sold for $10,000.
French: Sa maison a été vendue pour 10.000$.

English: I didn't like the way that movie ended.
French: Je n'ai pas aimé la façon dont le film s'est terminé.

English: There's something I want to show you.
French: Il y a quelque chose que je veux vous montrer.

English: Tom promised he wouldn't do that anymore.
French: Tom a promis qu'il ne ferait plus jamais cela.

English: How did I not know that?
French: Comment l'ignorais-je ?

English: I'm glad to finally meet you.
French: Je me réjouis de vous avoir finalement rencontrés.

English: Doesn't that mean anything to you?
French: Cela ne signifie-t-il rien pour toi ?

English: How are you planning to do that?
French: Comment tu prévois de faire ça ?

English: You're a good student, but you still have a lot to learn.
French: Vous êtes un bon élève, mais vous avez encore beaucoup à apprendre.

English: Where do you want to eat?
French: Où veux-tu manger ?

English: She had been sick for a week when I visited her.
French: Elle était malade depuis une semaine quand je lui ai rendu visite.

English: I will be glad to help you anytime.
French: Je serai heureux de vous aider n'importe quand.

English: Don't hesitate to ask questions if you don't understand.
French: N'hésitez pas à poser des questions si vous ne comprenez pas.

English: Most of this building's tenants are artists.
French: La plupart des locataires de l'immeuble sont des artistes.

English: She accused me of stealing her money.
French: Elle m'a accusé de lui avoir volé son argent.

English: Hand me the remote.
French: Passe-moi la télécommande.

English: He went fishing in the river.
French: Il alla pêcher dans la rivière.

English: Do you think I'm too materialistic?
French: Penses-tu que je sois trop matérialiste ?

English: Can you show me your boarding pass?
French: Pouvez-vous me montrer votre carte d'embarquement ?

English: I know how women think.
French: Je sais comme les femmes pensent.

English: Cover it up.
French: Camouflez-le.

English: I don't think Tom is in Boston.
French: Je ne pense pas que Tom soit à Boston.

English: There are no people on the moon.
French: Il n'y a personne sur la lune.

English: I don't know if I want to do that.
French: Je ne sais pas si je veux faire cela.

English: Don't you know how dangerous it is to go swimming by yourself?
French: Ne sais-tu pas combien il est dangereux d'aller nager seul ?

English: I believe you, but unfortunately Tom doesn't.
French: Je te crois, mais malheureusement Tom, lui, ne te croit pas.

English: Don't let your feelings show.
French: Ne montrez pas vos émotions.

English: Why not try some of that white wine?
French: Pourquoi ne pas essayer un peu de ce vin blanc ?

English: He needs money.
French: Il a besoin d'argent.

English: I must make up for lost time.
French: Je dois rattraper le temps perdu.

English: Get out of my bed.
French: Sortez de mon lit !

English: You're no help.
French: Vous n'êtes d'aucune aide.

English: When I was feeding my dog, I noticed that the gate had been left open.
French: En nourrissant mon chien, j'ai remarqué que le portail avait été laissé ouvert.

English: You won't go, will you?
French: Tu n'iras pas, si ?

English: I got soap in my eyes.
French: Je me suis pris du savon dans les yeux.

English: That's very flattering.
French: C'est très flatteur.

English: If you don't want to read, then don't.
French: Si vous ne voulez pas lire, alors ne lisez pas.

English: They made fun of my clothes.
French: Ils se sont moqués de mes vêtements.

English: I remember that guy.
French: Je me rappelle ce type.

English: I'll shoot both of you.
French: Je vous descendrai toutes les deux.

English: In short, he's run off without paying off his debt.
French: En bref, il s'est enfui sans payer ses dettes.

English: We both want the same thing.
French: Nous voulons tous les deux la même chose.

English: Goodbye. I'll see you at the time we agreed on.
French: Au revoir. Je vous verrai à l'heure dont nous avons convenu.

English: Children need a lot of sleep.
French: Les enfants requièrent beaucoup de sommeil.

English: Tom was just great.
French: Tom était tout simplement génial.

English: They always talk about the same things.
French: Ils parlent toujours des mêmes choses.

English: I must help you.
French: Je dois vous aider.

English: I'm getting sleepy.
French: Je commence à avoir sommeil.

English: My brother hung the picture upside down.
French: Mon frère a accroché le tableau à l'envers.

English: I think it's time for you to leave.
French: Je pense qu'il est temps pour vous de partir.

English: Will you lend your dictionary to me?
French: Tu me prêtes ton dictionnaire ?

English: Could you lend me some money?
French: Pourrais-tu me prêter de l'argent ?

English: Hurry up, girls.
French: On se grouille, les filles !

English: He asked for more money.
French: Il a demandé plus d'argent.

English: I was petrified.
French: J'étais pétrifié.

English: Do you really want to drop out of high school?
French: Tu veux vraiment abandonner le lycée ?

English: She has two brothers, who work in the computer industry.
French: Elle a deux frères qui travaillent dans l'informatique.

English: Keep writing.
French: Continue à écrire.

English: No other mountain in the world is so high as Mt. Everest.
French: Aucune montagne au monde n'atteint la hauteur du Mont Everest.

English: I thought you did fairly well.
French: J'ai pensé que tu t'en étais assez bien tirée.

English: He retorted that it was all my fault.
French: Il me rétorqua que tout était de ma faute.

English: Sorry for being late.
French: Désolé d'être en retard.

English: I didn't say you were crazy.
French: Je n'ai pas dit que tu étais fou.

English: I'm so happy that you're here.
French: Je suis tellement content que tu sois là.

English: Tom would enjoy doing that.
French: Tom devrait être content de le faire.

English: How dare you!
French: Comment osez-vous !

English: I'd like to live in New York.
French: J'aimerais vivre à New York.

English: He filled the glass with wine.
French: Il a rempli la coupe de vin.

English: In the summer I wear short-sleeved shirts.
French: En été je porte des chemises à manches courtes.

English: Two boys are absent from school today.
French: Deux garçons sont absents de l'école aujourd'hui.

English: Tom isn't like you.
French: Tom ne te ressemble pas.

English: You hit the bullseye.
French: Tu as touché au centre.

English: We'd better get out of here.
French: Nous ferions mieux de sortir d'ici !

English: How long do you have to eat lunch?
French: De combien de temps disposez-vous pour déjeuner ?

English: How does it help us?
French: En quoi est-ce que cela nous aide ?

English: We'll make an exception of your case.
French: Nous ferons une exception dans ton cas.

English: You're not helping, Tom.
French: Tu n'aides pas, Tom.

English: Let's get rid of that one.
French: Débarrassons-nous de celui-là.

English: I came yesterday.
French: Je suis venu hier.

English: She called him to say that she'd be late.
French: Elle l'appela pour lui annoncer qu'elle serait en retard.

English: I'll never forget what happened that night.
French: Je n'oublierai jamais ce qui s'est passé cette nuit-là.

English: What I'm about to say is strictly between you and me.
French: Ce que je vais dire doit seulement rester entre nous.

English: I will tell you more about Japan.
French: Je t'en dirai plus sur le Japon.

English: She divorced her husband.
French: Elle divorça de son mari.

English: Tom crossed the street.
French: Tom traversa la rue.

English: I think she'll succeed.
French: Je pense qu'elle réussira.

English: I think that's not true.
French: Je pense que ce n'est pas vrai.

English: The Great Lakes supply drinking water.
French: Les Grands Lacs fournissent de l'eau potable.

English: Tom is behind Mary.
French: Tom est derrière Marie.

English: Can someone please open the door?
French: Est-ce que quelqu'un peut ouvrir la porte, s'il vous plaît ?

English: This is a friend of mine.
French: C'est une amie à moi.

English: I found the earring that you lost.
French: J'ai trouvé la boucle d'oreille que vous aviez perdue.

English: I really need to be alone right now.
French: Il me faut vraiment être seul, à l'instant.

English: They don't listen to me.
French: Elles ne m'écoutent pas.

English: Button your coat up.
French: Boutonne ton manteau.

English: I'm pregnant.
French: Je suis enceinte.

English: French bread is delicious.
French: Le pain français est délicieux.

English: Those are very famous people.
French: Ce sont des gens très célèbres.

English: I felt like my life was over.

English: The most valuable skill one can acquire is the ability to think for oneself.
French: La compétence la plus précieuse que l'on puisse acquérir est celle d'être capable de penser par soi-même.

English: I think you should tell Tom you love him.

English: I called Tom up.

English: Take Tom for a swim.

English: I'm fine with it.

English: I'm weak.

English: I told him everything.

English: This stuff tastes awful.

English: This is a road map.

English: Someone stole my bicycle.

English: We weren't able to buy tickets, so we didn't go to the concert.
French: Nous n'avons pas pu acheter de places, nous ne sommes donc pas allé au concert.

English: Could you turn the heat down, please?

English: Our son died during the war.

English: I think that you're ugly.

English: I hope this can help someone.

English: How much time have you spent in Boston?

English: I'm smarter than you are.

English: She's completely blasé about the dangers of smoking.

English: He kept staring at me.

English: Let's not count on that happening.

English: Why are we being punished?

English: Do I need to wear a tie?

English: I revised my theory.

English: We're among friends.

English: I'll meet you outside.

English: It happened so quickly.

English: Did you hear that what's-his-face crashed his motorcycle?

English: I feel strongly about this.

English: Tom shut the kitchen door.

English: Certain smells can easily trigger childhood memories.

English: Don't say a word to anyone.

English: I don't know how to buy a ticket.

English: We always go to church on Christmas Eve.

English: I don't even want to know who you are.

English: Today, I watched a play written by a friend of mine.
French: Aujourd'hui, j'ai regardé une pièce écrite par une de mes amies.

English: What do you want from us?

English: I never thought it would be so exciting.

English: I can't tell you what you want to hear.

English: I have to make sure everything is OK.

English: Is there something in particular that you want to see?

English: I like that kind of work.

English: I am a shy boy.

English: She said that she was happy.

English: Sorry to interrupt you.

English: He is a very imaginative writer.

English: You're just a boy.

English: How are you connected?

English: I ate with my parents.

English: Let's begin our work at once.

English: I hope he's all right.

English: I'm all right.

English: I have to study for the exam.

English: Stop being so naive.

English: My sister came along on the shopping trip.

English: Are you sure you're warm enough?

English: Thanks for stopping by.

English: Luckily nobody got killed.

English: I just want to read the news.

English: Control yourselves.

English: You've got a black eye.

English: My bicycle is in need of repair.

English: We're saved.

English: A traffic accident deprived him of the use of his left hand.
French: Un accident de la route l’a privé de l’utilisation de sa main gauche.

English: He saved me from danger.

English: That's no lie.

English: We have room.

English: Have you got any ideas yet?

English: Degas was born more than 150 years ago.

English: Thank you for the cake.

English: I won't always be around to help you.

English: I don't have time for this.

English: What crime have I committed?

English: Don't worry.

English: They arrived at the hotel.
French: Ils arrivèrent à l'hôtel.

English: Gambling is a curse.

English: I suppose you've already applied for a visa.

English: Don't you have work today?

English: I don't sleep a lot.

English: She had to use her dictionary many times.

English: You're not allowed to go into that room.

English: I faxed Tom the information he asked for.
French: J'ai faxé à Tom l'information qu'il demandait.

English: I didn't know what was happening.

English: That was the idea.

English: You seem to know a great deal about me.

English: He opened the door.

English: Here's the money I owe you.

English: Did the trip live up to your expectations?

English: I will try again.

English: He danced all night long.
French: Il a dansé toute la nuit.

English: He has a lot of money in the bank.
French: Il a beaucoup d'argent à la banque.

English: What an interesting party!

English: I'd like a word with you in private.

English: Give it to me.

English: He fought until the end.

English: He's hopelessly in love.

English: It made sense.

English: I know that I haven't been a very good father.

English: He lost his temper and hit the boy.

English: I felt it was necessary, so I did it.

English: What did you want to talk to me about?

English: If you want, you can phone me.
French: Si tu veux, tu peux me téléphoner.

English: You can never be happy if you feel envious of other people.

English: She has a 10 percent interest in the company.
French: Elle détient dix pour cent des parts de l'entreprise.

English: Do you remember the first time you kissed me?

English: Tom left empty-handed.

English: Nobody's as fast as you.

English: You can't hurt me anymore.

English: He is doing well.

English: You look younger.

English: Do you need a hand with your suitcases?

French: Tom doit apprendre le japonais car il va au Japon l'année prochaine.

English: Just wait a second.

English: I keep saying that I'm innocent, but no one will listen.
French: Je continue de dire que je suis innocent, mais personne ne m'écoute.

English: Tom asked Mary to sweep the floor.
French: Tom a demandé à Mary de balayer par terre.

English: They're all here.

English: Honey, I love you.

English: Tom escaped with the help of a guard.
French: Tom s'est échappé avec l'aide d'un garde.

English: This vase is fragile.
French: Ce vase est fragile.

English: His room's a mess.

English: Do you know the reason why he cut class today?

English: Get away from me.

English: These boxes are heavy.

English: Not knowing what to do, I asked him for advice.
French: Ne sachant pas quoi faire, je lui ai demandé conseil.

English: Tom seems calm.

English: Don't let that dog come near me!
French: Ne laissez pas ce chien m'approcher !

English: You despise me, don't you?

English: Give it to anyone you like.
French: Donne-le à qui tu veux.

English: He begged us to go with him.
French: Il nous supplia de l'accompagner.

English: Frankly speaking, it was difficult for me to make out what he was saying.
French: Pour parler franchement, j'ai eu du mal à comprendre ce qu'il disait.

English: We shouldn't be seen together.
French: On ne devrait pas être vu tous les deux.

English: We sat there.

English: A book is always an acceptable gift.

English: He can swim like a fish.

English: I know exactly what needs to be done.

English: Are you smiling?

English: Can you tell us about it?

English: Come here quickly.

English: Do you fly frequently?

English: I wish I had time for a girlfriend.

English: Don't let this ruin your friendship.

English: We have snow in January.

English: This problem may be solved in a variety of ways.
French: Ce problème peut être résolu de différentes manières.

English: That man has a bad reputation.

English: He happened to catch sight of a rare butterfly.
French: Il advint qu'il aperçut un papillon rare.

English: We were playing chess.

English: There is a gold coin.

English: I took my shoes off and put them under the bed.

English: I am a student at Oxford University.
French: Je suis étudiant à l'université d'Oxford.

English: He gave up hope.

English: Do you feel it, too?

English: I just want you to tell me why you lied.

English: We saw paramedics treating the gunshot victims.
French: Nous vîmes des auxiliaires médicaux en train de traiter les victimes de la fusillade.

English: Tom put the vase on the table.
French: Tom a posé le vase sur la table.

English: We gave a party in celebration of his 70th birthday.
French: Nous avons fait une fête pour célébrer son 70e anniversaire.

English: I didn't catch what you said.
French: Je n'ai pas saisi ce que tu as dit.

English: We're not done playing yet.

English: They all went to the restaurant.

English: Brush your teeth after meals.

English: She risked her life to save him.

English: Charge it to my room.

English: We went on a picnic together.
French: Nous sommes allées ensemble en pique-nique.

English: He didn't tell me everything.

English: I don't want to study today.

English: I can't possibly manage it.

English: You've worked hard for months and have certainly earned a holiday.

English: There are no problems.

English: I'm wondering what I should do next.

English: I'm not stupid enough to lend him money.

English: I advise you never to live beyond your income.

English: Business is so slow these days.
French: Ces temps-ci, les affaires ne sont pas bonnes.

English: You're fashionable.

English: How about wearing contact lenses?

English: I played video games after I finished my homework.
French: J'ai joué à des jeux vidéo après avoir fini mes devoirs.

English: When are you coming back to Boston?

English: You must not smoke while working.

English: Three more passengers got on the bus.

English: I wish you could stay the night.

English: I won't bother you.
French: Je ne vais pas vous déranger.

English: There is a television in this room.
French: Il y a une télévision dans cette pièce.

English: I had to do this today.
French: J'ai dû le faire aujourd'hui.

English: The United States became a nation in 1776.
French: Les États-Unis sont devenus une nation en 1776.

English: I went to bed very late.
French: Je me suis mis au lit très tardivement.

English: I haven't yet gotten used to living here.
French: Je ne suis pas encore habitué à vivre ici.

English: Why did you help Tom escape?

English: I cleared my throat, but no words came.
French: Je m'éclaircis la gorge mais aucun mot ne me vint.

English: Can we speak French?

English: It's very easy to learn how to swim.
French: C'est très simple d'apprendre à nager.

English: He returned from China.
French: Il revint de Chine.

English: How do you respond to that?
French: Comment répondez-vous à cela ?

English: Get out.
French: Sors.

English: She used to enjoy being with him.
French: Elle prenait plaisir à être avec lui.

English: The water is hot.
French: L'eau est chaude.

English: This is hilarious.
French: C'est à se plier de rire.

English: I found something very interesting.
French: J'ai trouvé quelque chose de très intéressant.

English: Do not count your chickens before they are hatched.
French: Ne comptez pas vos poussins avant qu'ils ne soient éclos.

English: I remember many things.
French: Je me rappelle beaucoup de choses.

English: You can't imagine what my life's been like since you've left.
French: Tu ne peux pas imaginer ce que ma vie a été depuis que tu es partie.

English: I'm asking you as a friend.
French: Je vous le demande en tant qu'amie.

English: Do you get it?

English: She always believes me.

English: Did you understand me?

English: She was sticking her tongue out.
French: Elle tirait la langue.

English: How are you all doing?

English: She didn't intend to let him drive.
French: Elle n'avait pas l'intention de le laisser conduire.

English: Are you sure Tom is here?
French: Êtes-vous sûr que Tom est ici ?

English: I would do anything but that.

English: Why can't I hear?

English: Are you dyslexic?

English: Will you listen to me for a few minutes?
French: Voulez-vous m'écouter pendant quelques minutes ?

English: Tom says he needs to talk with you.
French: Tom dit qu'il a besoin de te parler.

English: I think you need help.
French: Je pense que tu as besoin d'aide.

English: He regrets his mistake.
French: Il regrette son erreur.

English: Tom doesn't need to consult anybody.
French: Tom n'a pas besoin de consulter quelqu'un.

English: You don't keep your promises.
French: Vous ne tenez pas vos promesses.

English: She was very excited.
French: Elle était très excitée.

English: The pain started last night.
French: La douleur a commencé la nuit dernière.

English: I didn't know where else to go.
French: J'ignorais à quel autre endroit aller.

English: I knew Tom was a bad driver.
French: Je savais que Tom était un mauvais conducteur.

English: My mom spoke with the school superintendent.
French: Ma maman a parlé avec le directeur de l'école.

English: This CD is mine, isn't it?
French: Ce CD est à moi, non ?

English: Tom has more free time than I do.
French: Tom a plus de temps libre que moi.

English: Sign here.
French: Signez ici.

English: I don't dare tell him such a thing.
French: Je n'ose pas lui dire une telle chose.

English: I'm ruthless.
French: Je suis impitoyable.

English: We saw you.
French: Nous vous avons vu.

English: That's exactly what I expected.
French: C'est exactement ce que j'escomptais.

English: I've drawn a map.
French: J'ai dessiné une carte.

English: The boy lifted the heavy box with one hand.
French: Le jeune homme souleva la lourde caisse d'une seule main.

English: It's just not right.
French: C'est simplement incorrect.

English: What was your question?
French: Quelle était votre question ?

English: I was at home almost all day yesterday.
French: J'étais chez moi presque toute la journée d'hier.

English: I wonder if Tom knows what Mary did.
French: Je me demande si Tom sait ce que Mary a fait.

English: Why did you get so angry?

English: Please don't do anything stupid.
French: S'il te plaît, ne fais rien de stupide.

English: I have a debt to pay.
French: J'ai une dette à payer.

English: I realized I couldn't win.
French: J'ai pris conscience que je ne pouvais pas gagner.

English: You're asking me to do something I don't want to do.
French: Vous me demandez de faire quelque chose que je ne souhaite pas faire.

English: Is there a reason that you're asking?
French: Y a-t-il une raison à votre demande ?

English: They love that song.
French: Elles adorent cette chanson.

English: Wait, why am I telling you this?
French: Attends ! Pourquoi suis-je en train de te dire ça ?

English: Do we know each other?
French: Nous connaissons-nous ?

English: Did I give you the tickets?
French: T'ai-je donné les places ?

English: Please stay.
French: Restez, s'il vous plaît.

English: Tom believed it.
French: Tom l'a cru.

English: I got hit by lightning.
French: J'ai été frappée par la foudre.

English: Do you have an English dictionary?
French: Est-ce que vous avez un dictionnaire d'anglais ?

English: Go home.
French: Rentrez chez vous.

English: We were both tired.
French: Nous étions tous les deux fatigués.

English: You'd make a good counselor.
French: Tu ferais un bon conseiller.

English: We all live in the same neighborhood.
French: Nous vivons tous dans le même quartier.

English: They all stood up at the same time.
French: Ils se levèrent tous en même temps.

English: He could not stand being kept waiting so long.
French: Il ne supportait pas qu'on le fasse attendre aussi longtemps.

English: He gave us an essay to write during the vacation.
French: Il nous a donné une rédaction à écrire pour les vacances.

English: You've been infected.
French: Vous avez été infectée.

English: I want your answer by the end of the day.
French: Je veux votre réponse pour la fin de la journée.

English: He didn't come on time.
French: Il n'arriva pas à l'heure.

English: Our stay has been very pleasant.
French: Notre séjour a été très agréable.

English: I'm certain.
French: Je suis certain.

English: What he said turned out to be a lie.
French: Ce qu'il a dit s'est avéré être un mensonge.

English: Ask me again some other time.
French: Demande-moi encore une autre fois.

English: We were at a loss what to do.
French: Nous ne savons que faire.

English: How did you come up with that answer?
French: Comment es-tu parvenue à cette réponse ?

English: I wonder if Tom is still eating lunch.
French: Je me demande si Tom déjeune encore.

English: I got sucked in on a lot of phony deals.
French: J'ai été entraîné dans plein de transactions bidon.

English: What did I do to deserve such treatment?
French: Qu'est-ce que j'ai fait pour mériter un tel traitement ?

English: I want it all.
French: Je veux tout.

English: He is leaving Chicago tomorrow.
French: Il va quitter Chicago demain.

English: It's lost.
French: C'est perdu.

English: I advised him to keep the secret.
French: Je lui ai conseillé de garder le secret.

English: You were seventh.
French: Tu as été septième.

English: You drive a hard bargain.
French: Vous êtes dur à cuire.

English: I don't often smile.
French: Je ne souris pas souvent.

English: You seem a little desperate.
French: Tu as l'air un peu désespérée.

English: You didn't see anyone come in, did you?
French: Vous n'avez vu personne entrer, n'est-ce pas ?

English: You are a student.
French: Tu es une étudiante.

English: A bottle of shampoo costs as much as a tube of toothpaste.
French: Un flacon de shampooing coûte autant qu'un tube de dentifrice.

English: I'd like to live in the suburbs of Kobe.
French: J'aimerais vivre dans la banlieue de Kobe.

English: She put the key in her bag.
French: Elle a mis la clé dans son sac.

English: Buy a book and read it.
French: Achetez un livre et lisez-le.

English: Can you catch the chicken?
French: Pouvez-vous attraper la poule ?

English: I had my purse and commuter ticket stolen while I was sleeping in the train.
French: On m'a dérobé mon sac à main et mon billet tandis que je dormais dans le train.

English: Are you trying to scare me?
French: Essayez-vous de me faire peur ?

English: It feels weird.
French: Ça fait drôle.

English: A minute has sixty seconds.
French: Une minute comprend soixante secondes.

English: The river flooded the whole region.

French: Il faut d'urgence une nouvelle approche pour traiter ce problème.

French: J'ai besoin de papier, de crayons, d'encre et ainsi de suite.

French: Aujourd'hui, ma femme et moi célébrons notre vingtième anniversaire de mariage.

English: I know what this is.
French: Je sais ce que c'est.

French: Ne revenez pas avant d'avoir fait ce que je vous ai demandé de faire !

French: Ce n'est pas que je ne veux pas y aller, c'est que je ne peux pas me le permettre.

French: Attendez ! Je veux vous montrer quelque chose.

English: I think that would be best.

French: J'ai besoin de vous parler en privé.

English: Do you need anything else?

French: Les chiens commencèrent à aboyer.

English: If you behave like a lackey, you'll be treated like a lackey.
French: Si tu agis comme un serviteur, tu seras aussi traité comme un serviteur.

French: Je pensais avoir entendu ta voix.

English: Try not to cry.
French: Essaie de ne pas pleurer !

English: At the next intersection, take a right.
French: À la prochaine intersection, prenez à droite.

English: Don't take this the wrong way.
French: Ne prenez pas ça de travers !

English: I think that we should go home now.
French: Je pense que nous devrions rentrer maintenant.

English: I just can't wait to go to work.
French: Je suis impatient d'aller au travail.

English: So, do you really want to do this?

English: A dye was injected into a vein of the patient's arm.
French: Un colorant a été injecté dans une veine du bras du patient.

English: Are you enjoying this?

English: I have to think of the future.
French: Je dois penser au futur.

English: One thing led to another.

English: I have to talk to you alone.

English: I want to help Tom as much as I can.
French: Je veux aider Tom autant que je peux.

English: Are you on your way home?

English: The same thing could be said about many other people.
French: On pourrait dire la même chose de nombreux autres gens.

English: I meant it as a joke.
French: Ça se voulait une blague.

English: He was almost drowned.
French: Il était presque noyé.

English: They did not have much food to eat.
French: Ils n'avaient guère à manger.

English: I'd like to forget the whole thing ever happened.

English: Your wish will come true in the near future.
French: Votre souhait se réalisera dans un proche avenir.

English: I didn't know this.

English: It's not always like this.

French: L'enfant n'avait pas de manteau alors qu'il faisait très froid.

French: Avez-vous reçu hier mon courriel avec les instructions ?

French: Véhiculer votre message est bien plus important que d'essayer de le dire exactement comme un locuteur natif le dirait.

English: The police believe the victim knew his killer.
French: La police croit que la victime connaissait son meurtrier.

French: Ça fait trois heures que je t'attends !

English: I didn't realize you were awake.

English: I'm really sorry to hear that.
French: Je regrette vraiment d'entendre ça.

English: English is spoken everywhere in the world now.
French: On parle anglais partout dans le monde maintenant.

English: You can't be hungry. You've just had dinner.

French: Tom a demandé à Marie de sortir pour dîner avec lui.

English: I think it's time for me to lose some weight.

English: It went viral.

English: He walked ahead of me.

English: I know all about you.

English: We're doing well.

English: Tom looked for his glasses.

English: You really are good.

English: As soon as I get to London, I'll drop you a line.

English: The roses were from Tom.

English: Has Tom been fired?

English: Are you happy doing that?

English: Cold water, please.

English: I'm used to Tom always yelling at me.

English: I left you a message at the front desk.

English: They all have come.

English: You must perform your duty.

English: You shouldn't look down on him.

English: The town is always crawling with tourists.

English: It's time you stopped watching television.

English: I worry about your health.

English: You're talented.

English: Tom didn't say that.

English: Are you still thirsty?

English: The door squeaked.

English: It is not a real mansion.

English: I've promised to do that.

English: This is useless.

English: He hurried to the station.

English: He went to the library.

English: Mary really is a very cute girl.

English: I asked him if he wanted a watch.

English: We're so proud of you!

English: It is said that treasure is buried in this area.

English: I am from Spain.

English: Tom will arrive in Boston tomorrow morning.

English: She was engrossed in her work.

English: Were you excited?

English: Tom gave Mary a music box.

English: It came as a surprise.

English: Don't just stand there, say something.

English: Could you actually eat this?

English: Would you look after my children while I am away on vacation?

English: Don't you play tennis?

English: How's it going?

English: We often eat raw fish.

English: Is he nice to her?

English: Why didn't you tell me about this?

English: I would like to kiss you.

English: Where did you meet my father?

English: Last Sunday, Mary and I went to the library together.
French: Dimanche dernier, Marie et moi sommes allés ensemble à la bibliothèque.

English: Please don't tell my wife.
French: Ne le dis pas à ma femme, s'il te plaît !

English: The storm raged in all its fury.

English: I'll pay you tomorrow.

English: I think we'd better ask Tom what he thinks.

English: I'm going with Tom.

English: My legs are fine.

English: I have one thousand dollars in travelers' checks and five hundred in cash.
French: J'ai mille dollars en chèques de voyage et cinq cents dollars en liquide.

English: They found no such proof.

English: Which hat do you want to buy?

English: He looked unfriendly at first.

English: Am I that transparent?

English: He is subject to fits of anger.

English: We'll have to wait a couple of hours.

English: That's very dishonest.

English: You don't seem to be as organized as Tom seems to be.
French: Tu ne sembles pas aussi organisé que Tom.

English: We gave it to the man.

English: He wanted to meet you.

English: You shouldn't say that kind of thing when children are around.
French: Vous ne devriez pas dire une telle chose lorsque les enfants sont dans les parages.

English: Is there any help available?
French: Y a-t-il une quelconque aide de disponible ?

English: We didn't reach the summit.

English: When is a good time for you?

English: This isn't supposed to be happening.

English: I have a lot to do this morning.

English: Look away.

English: What would the world be without women?

English: I'm uninsured.

English: People are not always what they seem.
French: Les gens ne sont pas toujours ce qu'ils paraissent être.

English: I know I got it right this time.

English: That was sweet.

English: I shouldn't have gone there by myself.

English: You have to pay in advance.
French: Vous devez payer d'avance.

English: Man can't live without dreams.

English: That's not true and you know it.
French: Ce n'est pas vrai et tu le sais.

English: Why are you asking these questions?

English: Is there anything to drink in the fridge?

English: I advised him to come back at once.
French: Je lui ai conseillé de revenir sans tarder.

English: He is anything but honest.

English: I want you to go to the doctor.

English: I'll pay later.

English: The plane should have arrived at Kansai Airport by now.
French: L'avion devrait être arrivé à l'aéroport de Kansai à présent.

English: Many great thinkers who were unknown while alive became famous after death.
French: De nombreux grands penseurs qui étaient inconnus de leur vivant, acquirent la renommée après leur mort.

English: Are you sure you're not imagining things?

English: Tom's father's name is John.
French: Le nom du père de Tom est John.

English: Did you ask Tom why?

English: Tom doesn't think he could do that.

English: He is lazy.

English: I owe ten dollars to her.

English: I didn't know you were staying at this hotel.

English: He was sitting on the floor.

English: They made me go there.

English: The telephone doesn't work.

English: He became the company president when he was thirty.

English: I always have to wear a tie because of my job.
French: Je dois toujours porter une cravate à cause de mon travail.

English: When did the robbery take place?

English: He is quite a savage.

English: I know he is busy.

English: Don't believe her because she always lies.

English: Don't they drive you mad?

English: I might be drunk, but I'm not crazy.

English: Hi. How are you doing?

English: I guess it's time to go.

English: I felt my heart beating violently.

English: I thought I was going crazy.

English: All of my friends have bicycles.
French: Tous mes amis ont des vélos.

English: Could you gift wrap it?

English: I didn't touch it.

English: She wept bitterly.
French: Elle pleura amèrement.

English: They all stopped.

English: I don't have the money to buy a car.
French: Je n'ai pas l'argent pour acheter une voiture.

English: Tom loved teaching French.
French: Tom a adoré enseigner le français.

English: Eat a lot of vegetables.

English: Everybody took a hostile attitude toward illegal aliens.

English: I can't believe I'm going to lose my job.

English: I just want to make sure it's not poison.

English: Instead of stopping, the rain increased.
French: Au lieu de s'arrêter, la pluie a repris de plus belle.

English: Why are you doing this?

English: What was the boy called?

English: We close at 7 p.m.

English: I have to do it by myself.

English: Why did you back away?

English: I tried standing on my head.

English: I didn't realize you were already here.

English: I'm afraid we don't have any left.

English: You'd have done the same.

English: I'm as tall as he is.

English: I'm not that drunk.

English: You came in late.

English: I want you to get in your car.
French: Je veux que tu montes dans ta voiture.

English: Did you get fired from your last job?

English: We don't want to lose.

English: Tom didn't mention any of this to me.

English: Tom rarely wears a tie.

English: You seem to know everything.

English: The United Nations sent troops to intervene in the conflict.

English: How many men do you have?

English: Tom is good at biology.
French: Tom est bon en biologie.

English: Let's start again.

English: Tom doesn't want to drive.
French: Tom ne veut pas conduire.

English: Let's see if we can help you.

English: Do you have a question?

English: I love comedies.

English: Tom has lost his wallet.
French: Tom a perdu son portefeuille.

English: We train together.

English: I can't believe I'm here again.

English: This railing is not as stable as it could be.

English: Be ruthless.

English: We're moving next month.

English: He carried a cane.

English: I just need time to think.

English: Tom doesn't sing very well.

English: She was panting.

English: What did Tom do today?

English: She has this big room all to herself.

English: We were fully satisfied.

English: I married a Canadian.

English: We're confident of victory.

English: The temperature is below zero today.

English: I'm not that stupid!

English: We heard gunshots.

English: Mary was wearing men's clothing.

English: Compare your answer with Tom's.

English: You have to stay.

English: He's cleaning out his closet.

English: First of all, I must say this.

English: Did you say 30?

English: I don't want to do that.

English: I am often in difficulties.

English: I don't believe in religion.

English: What are the causes?

English: Shall I heat this up? "No thank you, it's fine."
French: « Dois-je réchauffer ça ? » « Non merci, c'est bon. »

English: No one told us.

English: I don't understand you very well.

English: You can't do this alone.

English: Tom attended Mary's funeral.
French: Tom était présent à l'enterrement de Mary.

English: Are you mentally ill?

English: Tom is always dissatisfied.
French: Tom est toujours insatisfait.

English: I had the strangest dream last night.
French: J'ai fait le rêve le plus étrange, la nuit passée.

English: Can I ride with you?
French: Est-ce que je peux monter avec toi ?

English: I'm sorry that I can't be who you want me to be.
French: Je suis désolé de ne pouvoir être celui que tu voudrais que je sois.

English: I suppose it couldn't be helped.

English: All I have is books.
French: Tout ce dont je dispose, ce sont des livres.

English: Do we have to be so formal?

English: You're acting like a small child.

English: Tom and Mary washed the dishes together.
French: Tom et Mary ont fait la vaisselle ensemble.

English: You can't do both at the same time.
French: On ne peut pas faire les deux en même temps.

English: We all miss you very much.
French: Tu nous manques beaucoup à tous.

English: He goes swimming in the river every day.
French: Il va nager dans le fleuve tous les jours.

English: You cannot park your car here.
French: Tu ne peux pas garer ta voiture ici.

English: Do you have a phone?

English: You should be very proud of yourself.
French: Tu devrais être très fière de toi.

English: You're not the problem.

English: You were dying, but the doctor saved your life.
French: Vous étiez en train de mourir mais le médecin vous a sauvé la vie.
